newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling opens week stable.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling opens week stable.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling opened the week on Monday unchanged against the dollar, commercial bank dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted the shilling at a mean average of 54.79 unchanged from Friday against the dollar while against the pound it was posted at a mean rate of 89.28 from 89.32.
Dealers said thin inflows seen last week continued on Monday. "Many exporters have been holding on to their dollars hoping that the shilling would fall further," a dealer said.
"I expect actvity to pick up this week since they might come back," another dealer added.
The money market was tight with overnight rates quoted at 24-25 levels from Friday's lebels in excess of 25 percent.
